title:
Higher-order topology and bulk-boundary correspondence in a
  two-dimensional SSH model
abstract:
We extend the 1D SSH chain into two dimensions using inter-chain hopping $t$
with two specific pairs of edges produced with two different atoms. The
extension retains all of the 1D SSH model's symmetries on the global level. We
discovered that when individual SSH chains are in a non-trivial topological
phase and introduce a staggering amplitude between chains with a scenario $t<
v+w/2$, the system exhibits four zero energy modes that are confined to two of
the four corners of the system. Interestingly, two out of the four zero modes
are found to be associated with trimmers. No zero energy modes arise when the
chains are in the trivial topological phase with $t< v+w/2$. Further with a
critical look at the phase evolution of the Bloch states of the system we
identified a set of closed paths to define a winding number to characterize the
topological nature of the system. The Bulk-Corner correspondence is established
by calculating the winding number, varying between 2 and 1 in non-trivial
topological phase and found to be 0 in the trivial topological phase. Based of
this study we characterize the system with four localized corner modes and a
bulk winding number 2 appears to be a Second-order topological insulator.
